content:
Which of the following BEST describes how the most accurate
value for the gravitational constant has been determined:
W) through theoretical calculations from General Relativity
X) through theoretical calculations using the masses and motions of certain celestial bodies
Y) through theoretical calculations from quantum electrodynamics
Z) through experimentation
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following BEST describes how Thomas Young
produced sufficiently coherent separate light sources in order to produce interference patterns:
W) passing coherent light through 2 closely spaced holes in the same opaque screen
X) passing incoherent light 1st through an opaque screen with a single hole, and then through a 2nd
opaque screen with 2 holes
Y) passing polarized light through 2 holes in a single opaque screen
Z) passing laser light through 2 holes in a single opaque screen
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) PASSING INCOHERENT LIGHT 1st THROUGH AN OPAQUE SCREEN WITHA SINGLE HOLE, AND THEN THROUGH A 2nd OPAQUE SCREEN WITH 2 HOLES

content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) a reaction that requires free energy is spontaneous
X) gases, as a group, have higher entropies than liquids
Y) standard molar entropies of pure substances are always positive values
Z) spontaneous processes involve non-equilibrium conditions
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: W) A REACTION THAT REQUIRES FREE ENERGY IS SPONTANEOUS

content:
Consider the reaction, N + 3H  2NH . If the
2(gas) 2(gas) 3(gas)
concentration of ammonia increases from 0.3 molar to 0.9 molar in a 10-minute period, find the
average rate of reaction over this time interval. Give your answer to the 2nd decimal place in moles
per liter minute:
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What enzyme in E. coli functions as the primary proof-reading
molecule during replication?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of DNA replication:
W) it is initiated by a short DNA primer
X) the growing strand is polymerized in a 5-prime to 3-prime direction
Y) DNA polymerase helps form the phosphodiesterase (read as: FOSS-foe-die-ESS-ter-ase) bonds
Z) synthesis of the lagging strand is discontinuous
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: W) IT IS INITIATED BY A SHORT DNA PRIMER

content:
A data set has a mean of 10 and variance of 10. If every set element is
multiplied by 2, which of the following is TRUE of the new mean and variance:
W) mean is 20, variance is 40
X) mean is 20, variance is 10
Y) mean is 20, variance is 20
Z) mean is 10, variance is 20
subject: MATH

content:
Convert the angle, 18º18’36” (read as: 18 degrees, 18 minutes, 36
seconds) to degrees, to the second decimal place:
subject: MATH

content:
A meromictic lake has layers of water that typically:
W) intermix once a year
X) intermix each spring and autumn
Y) intrtmix only when the winds are favorable
Z) do not intermix
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
EARTH SCIENCE

content:
In which of the following processes would isinglass
(read as: eye-zen-glass) most likely be used:
W) clarification of beers and wines
X) baking of yeast-free breads
Y) glazing of ceramics
Z) thickening of puddings
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) CLARIFICATION OF BEERS AND WINES

content:
In which of the following instances would using a
student t-test be most appropriate:
W) comparing yes or no answers on a single question on a questionnaire
X) determining statistical differences between 5 different age groups of males that received a drug
that increases red blood cell production
Y) finding the statistical differences between two groups in an experiment on a drug’s effect in
raising or lowering blood pressure
Z) comparing the strengths of 5 different types of fishing lines
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Y) FINDING THE STATISTICAL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN TWO GROUPS INAN EXPERIMENT ON A DRUG’S EFFECT IN RAISING OR LOWERING BLOOD PRESSUREHigh School Round 15 Page 3

content:
Which of the following positions is an inferior planet most
likely in if it is seen just after sunset:
W) opposition
X) superior conjunction
Y) greatest eastern elongation
Z) greatest western elongation
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
According to the Pogson scale for brightness, by what multiple
does the brightness of 2 stars differ that have apparent magnitudes of +3 and +8?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
To early astrophysical researchers, the Sun was originally found to
emit about one-third of the expected amount of neutrinos. Which of the following BEST explains
why:
W) about 66% of the neutrinos were deflected by the Earth’s magnetic field
X) two-thirds of the neutrinos were too energetic to be detected
Y) neutrinos were changing flavor on their way to Earth
Z) original estimations of the numbers emitted by the Sun were incorrect
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Y) NEUTRINOS WERE CHANGING FLAVOR ON THEIR WAY TO EARTH

content:
If you were using a 50-millimeter camera lens and changed the lens
aperture from 8.0 to 5.6, about how much LESS light would the lens be allowing to pass through it:
W) 60% less
X) 50% less
Y) 35% less
Z) 22% less
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following is NOT generally true of reaction
equilibria:
W) if the temperature of an exothermic reaction is raised, the equilibrium shifts to the left
X) the equilibrium constants for forward and reverse reactions are the reciprocals of each other
Y) pure liquids appear in the equilibrium expression but pure solids do not
Z) an equilibrium constant greater than 1 means that the reaction favors products at equilibrium
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: Y) PURE LIQUIDS APPEAR IN THE EQUILIBRIUM EXPRESSION BUT PURESOLIDS DO NOT(Solution: pure solids and liquids do not appear in the equilibrium expression)

content:
Calculate ∆Gº (read as: delta G naught), giving your answer in
kilojoules, for a reaction in which ∆Hº = +180 kilojoules and ∆Sº = +100 joules per kelvin at
300 kelvin and 1 atmosphere pressure:
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following is MOST characteristic of human blast
cells in on observation with light microscopy:
W) large nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio
X) small nucleolus and mostly heterochromatin in the nucleus
Y) lack of cytoplasmic granules and small overall size compared to mature cells
Z) absence of nucleolus (read as: NEW-clee-oh-luss) and endoplasmic reticulum
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: W) LARGE NUCLEAR TO CYTOPLASMIC RATIO

content:
What specific molecule binds immediately upstream of the structural
genes in the lac (read as: LACK) operon and functions to transcribe these genes?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
The graph of r = 3 secant (θ) (read as: r = 3 secant theta) is a:
W) parabola
X) circle
Y) hyperbola
Z) line
subject: MATH

content:
Give the resulting vector for the cross product of vector 1,0,0 with
vector 0,0,1 :
subject: MATH

content:
When sampling for organic matter in seawater, any
organic matter retained by a 0.2 micrometer pore filter is classified as:
W) dissolved organic carbon
X) particulate organic carbon
Y) detrital organic carbon
Z) live or dead marine algae
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following soil additives would be most
efficient at increasing the acidity of a slightly alkaline soil:
W) ground chalk
X) aluminum sulfate
Y) calcium sulfate
Z) calcium carbonate
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: X) ALUMINUM SULFATEHigh School Round 15 Page 6

content:
Clean or unpolluted rain water has a pH of about:
W) 5.6
X) 6.5
Y) 7.0
Z) 7.6
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following plays the greatest role in the
effect of acid rain on the environment:
W) the ability of soils and bedrock to neutralize the acid
X) the initial pH of the rain in the upper troposphere
Y) low-level ozone concentration
Z) temperature of the troposphere
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) THE ABILITY OF SOILS AND BEDROCK TO NEUTRALIZE THE ACID

content:
Which of the following is closest to the age of most
chondrites:
W) 150 million years
X) 1.5 billion years
Y) 4.6 billion years
Z) 13.7 billion years
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Y) 4.6 BILLION YEARS(Solution: most are about the same age as our solar system)

content:
Which of the following best describes the hydrogen spectral
line strength for an A-type star of about 3 solar masses:
W) missing
X) weak
Y) medium
Z) strong
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which of the following BEST describes spin quantum numbers:
W) orientation of intrinsic angular momenta of electrons
X) centripetal accelerations of atoms
Y) angular momenta of only hadrons
Z) centripetal acceleration of electrons
subject: PHYSICS
answer: W) ORIENTATION OF INTRINSIC ANGULAR MOMENTA OF ELECTRONS

content: What is the spin of the muon, in quantum units?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: ½(Solution: muons are fermions which have a spin of ½)

content:
Which of the following substances has the greatest density:
W) hexane
X) methylene chloride
Y) diethyl ether
Z) ethyl acetate
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: X) METHYLENE CHLORIDE(Solution: halogenated solvents possess a higher density than non-halogenated ones)

content:
Which of the following molecules is most likely to have a zero
dipole moment based on its molecular shape:
W) PF
3
X) H O
2
Y) PCl
3
Z) BeF
2
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the most common name for the first membrane-associated
molecule discovered to function in a wide variety of cells in what is commonly referred to as a
second messenger?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
With which of the following are cyclin-dependent kinases most
directly involved:
W) repairing damaged DNA
X) regulating cell cycle
Y) digesting plasmids
Z) insulin’s action on fat cells
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What is the angle formed, in degrees, between the hour and minute hand
of an analog clock at 10:30 AM?
subject: MATH

content:
Arrange the following 4 radicals in order of increasing value:
6 12 ; 6 63; 3 2; 4 8
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following is TRUE regarding the Hadley
cell:
W) it creates an area of high pressure along the equator
X) it is an open ocean circulation at 30º north and south latitudes
Y) it originates at the equator with strong solar heating
Z) it is the only air circulation that is not affected by the Coriolis effect
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Y) IT ORIGINATES AT THE EQUATOR WITH STRONG SOLAR HEATING

content:
Name all of the following 3 lavas from which
stratovolcanoes are typically composed: andesite; rhyolite; basalt
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is the primary detrimental
effect to humans and animals who ingest high levels of melamine:
W) impaired nerve transmission
X) impaired kidney function
Y) liver failure
Z) severe gastrointestinal distress
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is one of the main unique
capabilities of the GLAST observatory:
W) it operates completely on photovoltaic cells
X) it contains the largest superconducting magnet in space
Y) it can survey the entire celestial sphere several times each day
Z) it orbits the Moon
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Y) IT CAN SURVEY THE ENTIRE CELESTIAL SPHERE SEVERAL TIMESEACH DAYHigh School Round 15 Page 10

content:
In astronomical units to the first decimal place, what is the
Chandrasekhar Limit?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
If a new Moon occurs on May 5th at 8:20 AM eastern daylight
time, on what day will the full Moon occur that month?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content: Uranium-238 and plutonium-239, primarily decay by what mode?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: ALPHA (ACCEPT: ALPHA EMISSION or ALPHA DECAY)

content:
What is the name of the instrument invented by Charles Wilson and
used in the early 1900’s in many experiments to show the tracks of charged particles passing through
a chamber?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: CLOUD CHAMBER (ACCEPT: WILSON CLOUD CHAMBER)High School Round 15 Page 11

content:
What chemical term is given to the formations that occur in water
when a hydrophilic head and a hydrophobic tail organize into spheres that orient the tails within the
sphere?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Using proper chemical nomenclature, finish balancing the
following combustion reaction for the gaseous products of carbon dioxide and water:
2C H + 13O  what?
4 10(gas) 2(gas)
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
From what basic plant cell type are the majority of cells in a corm
(read as: KORM) composed?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
If a germ cell of a genus of grass has 48 chromosomes at metaphase-
two, how many chromosomes will a germ cell of this grass have in anaphase-two?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 3 molecules that are considered
saturated hydrocarbons: ethylene; ethane; cyclohexane
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
How many milliliters of a 0.250 molar H SO solution will react
2 4
with 10 milliliters of a 0.250 molar NaOH solution
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: 5(Solution: N = (2eq/mol)(0.250 mol/L) = 0.5 eq/L; N = 0.250 eq/L;H2SO4 NaOH(N )(V = (N )(V ); (0.5 meq/ml)(x) = (0.25 meq/ml)(10 ml) = 5 ml)H2SO4 H2SO4) naOH NaOHHigh School Round 15 Page 13
